docs.title: Welcome
docs.text:
Welcome to Qualification and Selection of Open Source Software (QSOS) project – your ultimate guide to navigating the vast world of open source solutions! QSOS is a comprehensive method designed to help you effectively evaluate and select the best open source software for your projects.

QSOS is also a collaborative project aiming to mutualize and capitalize technological watch on open source components and projects.

The method comes in two flavors:

  • QSOS Full

    A complete method to evaluate, compare and select open source software solutions on both maturity, technical, and functional aspects.

  • QSOS Lite

    A simplified version of QSOS that allows you to quickly identify the best open source software solutions for your projects regarding maturity criteria.

Start your QSOS journey today and unlock the potential of open source software for your projects!

Obsolete toolset

Tools mentionned in the QSOS Full version are deprecated and not maintained any more.

With the full QSOS Method, you can dive into a structured approach that considers not just the technical aspects but also the functional and strategic requirements of your software needs.

Whether you are a seasoned developer, a tech enthusiast, or a business looking to optimize your information systems, QSOS provides a systematic way to analyze, compare, and choose the right open source tools.

Our method empowers you to ask the right questions:

  • What are the specific constraints and risks associated with open source software?
  • How can you differentiate between various software options based on technical, functional, and strategic criteria?
  • What level of stability and support can you expect from a particular software?
  • Is it possible to influence the development of the software to meet your evolving needs?

Join our community-driven project to explore the QSOS Radar, access evaluation templates, and contribute to the continuous improvement of our method. Let QSOS be your compass in the open sea of software choices, guiding you towards informed decisions and successful implementations.

docs.title: Maturity Model
docs.text:
QSOS Lite is a subpart of the QSOS Method, limited to its Maturity Model.

It is a practical and easy way to assess the maturity of open source software and projects. It is a quick and easy way to understand the maturity of a software solution.

  • Legacy: Evaluates the project's history, age, past experiences, core team strength, and popularity among users.
  • Activity: Focuses on the level of activity within the project, including community engagement, bug fixing, feature development, and release management.
  • Governance: Examines the project's strategy, including copyright ownership, decision-making processes, and overall governance structure.
  • Industrialization: Looks at the level of industrialization in the project, including feature request processes, roadmap availability, and release planning.
